intro: Pseudocymopterus anisatus var. longilobus, commonly known as the long-lobed false cymopterus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with distinct lobes, giving it its varietal name. Its flowers are small, white to pale yellow, and clustered in umbels, typical of the family. This variety is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes.
